comments.text:
Created attachment 574025
Unbenannt.png

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111104165243

Steps to reproduce:

this bug will happen on any site, if you have noscript installed (most actual version). if you navigate through the noscript-menu while pressing the windows button, firefox crashed. 


Actual results:

firefox 8 crashed


Expected results:

the noscript navigation should close

comments.raw_text:
When you crash do you get the crash reporter and submit crash data to us? If so please open the page about:crashes and copy some of the links into this bug.

Note: Please visit the links first to make sure they were submitted properly. Sometimes they don't go through the first time in order to keep the server load down. If that happens they're only stored locally on your machine unless you indicate you are interested by clicking on them.

What version of NoScript are you using?

comments.raw_text:
I have found out a new detail:

The crash happens only, if NoScript provides a cascaded navigation 
for the respective site AND if this deeper navigation is visible on the screen. With only the initial NoScript navigation shown, everything works fine.

Here are my results. The crash is reproduceable even with Avast uninstalled:

NoScript 2.2 and Avast 6.01289 activated
https://crash-stats.mozilla.com/report/index/bp-514a114f-cf94-403b-9785-51ee12111117

NoScript 2.2 and Avast 6.01289 only disabled
https://crash-stats.mozilla.com/report/index/bp-96007a18-cb1a-46b7-be32-53a0a2111117

NoScript 2.2 and Avast 6.01289 uninstalled (with proper restart)
https://crash-stats.mozilla.com/report/index/bp-bc1190bb-8f81-4a53-b11c-5695d2111117

comments.raw_text:
K0nne, we don't normally make active security issues public.

If you have time, can you give more explicit steps to reproduce this issue? What menus are you opening in what order to invoke the crash?
comments.text:
K0nne, we don't normally make active security issues public.

If you have time, can you give more explicit steps to reproduce this issue? What menus are you opening in what order to invoke the crash?

Hi Al!

It is really simple an reproduceable (at least with my pc) with any site where you can make it happen to have an opened no-script submenu as displayed here:

http://www.imagebanana.com/view/98b79x8u/Unbenannt.png

If this sub-menu is still visible and you press the windows button, firefox crashes:

https://crash-stats.mozilla.com/report/index/bp-e36a9f35-bd39-4e7d-9756-4eec12120216

If the noscript menu for a site offers an cascadable submenu, wich is not opened and you press win everything works as expected .. the noscript-menu is closing and the win7 startmenu appears.
comments.raw_text:

comments.text:
I can reproduce on trunk by following the steps outlined in comment 8, but I'm opening the bug because this doesn't seem exploitable and anyway requires a fair amount of hard to social-engineer user interaction.

On a side note, the crash seems caused by some Windows-specific weirdness in popup-switch handling, and even if triggered by NoScript's submenu I believe it should be fixed in Core.
comments.raw_text:
I can reproduce on trunk by following the steps outlined in comment 8, but I'm opening the bug because this doesn't seem exploitable and anyway requires a fair amount of hard to social-engineer user interaction.

On a side note, the crash seems caused by some Windows-specific weirdness in popup-switch handling, and even if triggered by NoScript's submenu I believe it should be fixed in Core.
